name: "Big Bad Beetleborgs" - The Pilot Quiz  | 10 Questions

questions.text: What is the name of the comic book store that the main characters are hanging out in near the beginning of the episode?
questions.explanation:
Zoom Comics.

	Zoom Comics is the only comic shop in the series. The other three are names of actual stores in the Metro Detroit region. The store name can be seen several times in the scene. It appears both on the sign and the front window.

questions.text: What is the name of the mansion that the kids were exploring in the very first scene?
questions.explanation:
Hillhurst House.

	The house is known to be haunted, though the extent of the haunting isn't really known. In the opening scene, the town bullies are seen running out of the house, very much in fear. One of them dropped a cellphone and couldn't return to get it because he was so scared.

questions.text: What was the first "spooky" thing to happen while the kids were exploring the house?
questions.correct: Birds came alive and flew out of a painting.
options: A mummy walked out of a coffin in the closet.
A glass levitated in the air.
questions.explanation:
Birds came alive and flew out of a painting.

	Andrew, Roland and Jo, the future Beetleborgs, were just starting up the stairs in the front room of the house when the birds flew out of the painting behind them. These were same two birds that Andrew had just mentioned looked "so real". The painting then was blank.

questions.text: What type of creature was Flabber?
questions.explanation:
Phantasm.

	Flabber was a phantasm who lived in the the mansion's pipe organ. He was a powerful magician with pure white skin. He had a personality that was a cross between Elvis and Liberace.

questions.text: There were five Beetleborgs in the first season.
questions.explanation:
False.

	The three Beetleborgs were based on characters in the comic book the kids had been reading earlier in the episode. When Roland wished the three could be the Beetleborgs, Flabber accidentally brought forth the villains out of the book as well.

questions.text: Which Beetleborg was the team leader?
questions.explanation:
Drew.

	Drew was the Blue Stingerborg, with the Stingerblade weapon. He was the team leader. Jo was the red Beetleborg and Roland the green Beetleborg. In later episodes the white Beetleborg was introduced.

questions.text: Who was the leader of the evil Magnavores?
questions.explanation:
Vexor.

	All four answer choice were members of the villainous group. The Magnavores were released from the same comic that the Beetleborgs came from. They served as the main series villains for more than 50 first season episodes.

questions.text: Where did the Magnavores build their secret base?
options: In the basement of a mansion.
questions.explanation:
In a cemetery.

	The villains secret base is hidden under a cemetery. They travel to and from the hidden layer via a portal hidden inside a coffin.

questions.text: All of the Beetleborgs were male.
questions.explanation:
False.

	Roland and Drew were guys, and later Josh, but Jo was Drew's younger sister. She was the smartet on the team, but also the least respected.

questions.text: What fictional town is the show set in?
questions.explanation:
Charterville.

	The sign showing "Welcome to Charterville" is displayed prominently at the beginning of each episode. Many of the store fronts seen in the show also display the town name.
